main event: A bright light was observed hovering near the ground, climbing rapidly, leaving a trail of light, and then disappearing on March 12, 1959, near Hidden Valley.
interesting points: The observation involved three large luminous objects seen after 5:25 P.M. near Hidden Valley.
The observer, a person of legal intelligence, refrained from reporting immediately due to personal problems and family illness.
The observation was noted to have a trail of light left behind as the bright light climbed rapidly before disappearing.
The UFO was observed to be silent with a very slight whining noise, estimated to be in excess of 700 mph, resembling an aircraft but with no visible trail or exhaust.
Despite detailed analysis, the unidentified flying object described was not visible in the film processed by the Aerospace Technical Intelligence Center.
witnesses: one witness, a person of legal intelligence
photographs: no photographs available in the report
